essay_data.topic_prompt: Imagine you were surfing with your friend and a tsunami started to form. If you knew a tsunami was forming like the video, what would you do first? Write a paragraph with two reasons to support your answer.
essay_data.submit_text: I will move to a higher ground. I have two reasons. First, Because tsunamis are dangerous. Because tsunamis can sweep us away. Second, tsunamis are big waves. But it can't come at the high ground. For these reasons, I will move to a higher ground.

corrections.highlight: First, Because tsunamis are dangerous. Because tsunamis can sweep us away.
corrections.correction: First, tsunamis are dangerous because they can sweep us away.

corrections.highlight: Second, tsunamis are big waves. But it can't come at the high ground.
corrections.correction: Second, tsunamis are big waves, but they cannot reach higher ground.

grammar.feedback: Clear meaning but noticeable beginner errorsâ€”fix sentence fragments, capitalization, pronouns, and articles.

corrections.highlight: Because tsunamis are dangerous. Because tsunamis can sweep us away.
corrections.correction: Combine into one sentence: 'Tsunamis are dangerous because they can sweep people away.'

corrections.highlight: But it can't come at the high ground.
corrections.correction: Rewrite as: 'Tsunamis cannot reach high ground.'

introduction.feedback: Topic and direction are clear; fix fragments and the unclear sentence for smoother introduction.

corrections.highlight: First, Because tsunamis are dangerous. Because tsunamis can sweep us away.
corrections.correction: Combine and rewrite: "First, tsunamis are dangerous because they can sweep us away."

corrections.highlight: But it can't come at the high ground.
corrections.correction: Clarify and correct: "Second, tsunamis are big waves, but they can't reach high ground."

body.feedback: Clear main idea with reasons; fix fragments and clarify the high-ground sentence for smoother flow.

corrections.correction: Combine: "First, tsunamis are dangerous because they can sweep us away."

corrections.highlight: But it can't come at the high ground.
corrections.correction: Clarify: "A tsunami cannot reach high ground."

essay_data.topic_prompt: If you could visit any planet in the solar system, which planet would you want to visit?
essay_data.submit_text:
Do you know good at planet? I not good. But, I want to go a mar. If I could visit any planet, then I would visit mars.

First, mars can almost people leave on this planet. Because, here has a little water and people need things. And also mars is not long to go.

Second, Mar's is not hot and cold. So, the people can go and explore the Martian. But, I have car, head ack so I think go a mars is very hard to go for me.

In conclusion, I want to go a mar. Because, mars is almost good to live in here and temperatures are okay for people.

corrections.correction: I want to go to Mars.

corrections.correction: Mars could nearly support human life.

essay_data.topic_prompt: Do you think it is possible to reunify North and South Korea?
essay_data.submit_text:
Do you believe that reunification of Korea is possible? Many people are putting efforts on reunification, but there are very hard problems to solve for reunifying. I think that reunification of North and South Korea is not possible

First of all, there are political differences between North and South Korea. North and South Korea has very different political systems and ideologies. North Korea's system is centralized and authoritarian, with a unique political system that combines elements of communism and totalitarianism. North Korea's political system is primarily based on a one-man leadership system and the Juche ideology. South Korea, on the other hand, is a liberal democracy based on a presidential system in which representatives elected by the people from the National Assembly and the government to make and enforce laws. Democratic principles such as a free press, freedom of expression, and fair elections are guaranteed.

Additionally, there are social and cultural barriers between Koreas. Korean War has led to different political systems and social and cultural characteristics of two Koreas. North Korea maintains a communist system in which the state controls all industries and agriculture, but South Korea has a free market economy and guarantees individual economic freedom. These differences have a major impact on the structure of society and the standard of living. North and South Korea also differ in language and cultural expression. North and South Korea use different Koreans. Also, North Korea emphasizes communist education and culture, while South Korea respects diverse cultures and arts.

To conclude, I think that reunification of two Koreas is impossible because there are political differences and political differences between North and South Korea.

corrections.highlight: North and South Korea has very different political systems and ideologies.
corrections.issue: subject-verb agreement (plural subject requires plural verb)
corrections.correction: North and South Korea have very different political systems and ideologies.

corrections.highlight: North and South Korea use different Koreans.
corrections.correction: North and South Korea use different dialects (varieties) of Korean.

grammar.feedback: Meaning is clear but agreement, article, and word-choice errors reduce sophistication; focus on accuracy and concision.

corrections.highlight: I think that reunification of North and South Korea is not possible
corrections.issue: Vague thesis lacking precise reasons or nuance
corrections.correction: Make a precise, arguable thesis that names main reasons: e.g., 'Reunification is unlikely due to entrenched political systems, vast economic disparities, and deep socio-cultural divergence.'

corrections.highlight: Many people are putting efforts on reunification, but there are very hard problems to solve for reunifying.
corrections.issue: Weak, generic context and no structural preview
corrections.correction: Give a concise contextual hook (historical division and stakes) and preview the essay's structure (political, economic, social-cultural obstacles).

introduction.feedback: Clear position but needs a sharper thesis and brief roadmap explaining how you'll support that claim.

corrections.highlight: To conclude, I think that reunification of two Koreas is impossible because there are political differences and political differences between North and South Korea.
corrections.correction: Replace with a concise thesis specifying which political differences impede reunification and briefly preview the supporting reasons.

corrections.highlight: North and South Korea also differ in language and cultural expression. North and South Korea use different Koreans.
corrections.issue: unclear and inaccurate phrasing about language
corrections.correction: Clarify that decades of separation produced dialectal and cultural divergence; use 'different dialects and cultural practices' instead.

body.feedback: Sharpen the thesis, add concrete evidence, and clarify language and cultural claims for stronger analysis.

corrections.highlight: To conclude, I think that reunification of two Koreas is impossible because there are political differences and political differences between North and South Korea.
corrections.correction: Revise to synthesize reasons and avoid repetition: "In sum, deep ideological, political, economic, and cultural divisions make reunification unlikely without major transformation; focus should be on pragmatic cooperation and humanitarian steps."

corrections.highlight: Do you believe that reunification of Korea is possible? Many people are putting efforts on reunification, but there are very hard problems to solve for reunifying. I think that reunification of North and South Korea is not possible
corrections.issue: weak opening and no purposeful closing
corrections.correction: Replace with a concise closing that reflects the essay's evidence and suggests implications or next steps for policy or research.

conclusion.feedback: Clear position but repetitive and shallow; strengthen synthesis and end with a purposeful, implication-driven closing.

essay_data.topic_prompt: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teenagers should not have cosmetic surgery._x000D_
essay_data.submit_text:
Do you agree or disagree about teenagers should not have cosmetic surgery? I think teenagers can do cosmetic surgery.

First, teenagers can do cosmetic surgery. Because these days many teenagers bully other kid with their face or their body. So the bullied kid could get stressed. When they get a lot of stress the bullied kid would think that she really face and bad and she is fat. But when they do cosmetic surgery they don't have to bleed by shoal classmate. They don't have to be afraid.

Second, I think teenagers can't do cosmetic surgery is a discrimination because teenagers is being an adult. The are not young. So I think teenagers can do cosmetic surgery. Also, these days, there have many safety cosmetic surgery equipments and these they science has developed so there have a lot of smart robots. So, I think cosmetic surgery for teenagers is safe and not have sideffects.

Third, when teenagers do cosmetic surgery it is their choice when they don't like it, they can't turn it back. Teenagers had developed brain so their choice and the result is their fault or their good. When they go out in soical they will have to choose more big thing then cosmetic surgery. Their choose would change their life or better or become worse. So, teenagers could practice with this cosmetic surgery. When they want to do surgery.

These are the reason that I think teenagers should have cosmetic surgery.

grammar.feedback: Frequent grammar errors: fragments, agreement, articles, and spelling; rewrite sentences and correct verb/pronoun choices.

corrections.highlight: Do you agree or disagree about teenagers should not have cosmetic surgery? I think teenagers can do cosmetic surgery.
corrections.issue: awkward phrasing, grammatical errors, no compelling hook or expert context
corrections.correction: Rewrite to open with a clear, expert-level hook and context, for example: "Cosmetic surgery for adolescents is increasingly contested: critics cite developmental and ethical risks, while advocates emphasize autonomy and mental-health benefits. I argue that, under strict age limits, robust informed consent, and clear medical-necessity criteria, older teenagers should be eligible for limited cosmetic procedures."

corrections.highlight: I think teenagers can do cosmetic surgery.
corrections.issue: simple assertion lacks nuance and roadmap of the essay's arguments
corrections.correction: Turn the thesis into a nuanced claim and add a brief roadmap: "I contend that, with safeguards (psychological screening, parental involvement when appropriate, and regulatory oversight), teenagers may access certain procedures â€” I will address bullying/mental health, autonomy/legal status, and safety/technology advances."
